intro: Ischaemum amboliense, commonly known as the Amboli grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is native to the western Himalayas and is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The plant has slender, tufted stems and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny florets. Its leaves are narrow and often have a bluish-green hue, and it is adapted to thrive in cooler, humid climates. Ischaemum amboliense is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and limited distribution.
